abstract: As Goldman Sachs prepared to repay $10 billion in government bailout money on Wednesday, its chief executive, Lloyd C. Blankfein, told leading Congressional lawmakers on Tuesday that he regretted Goldman had “participated in the market euphoria” that led to the financial crisis.

lead_paragraph: As Goldman Sachs prepared to repay $10 billion in government bailout money on Wednesday, its chief executive, Lloyd C. Blankfein, told leading Congressional lawmakers on Tuesday that he regretted that Goldman had “participated in the market euphoria” that led to the financial crisis.

headline.main: Goldman Regrets ‘Market Euphoria’ That Led to Crisis
